alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:58AM MDT until further notice by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Nashua affecting Valley County. .Warm temperatures will melt the existing snowpack, leading to increased runoff and river flows. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Nashua. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Nashua Boulevard will begin to flood east of the MT 117 railroad overpass and west of town. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 25.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM MDT Monday was 25.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 27.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall early Thursday afternoon. It will rise to 27.8 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.6 feet on 04/18/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM MDT.
